context.description: New Message Set wizard Use this wizard to create a new message set. Before you start, you must have already created the message set project in which you want to create the message set. You can create a message set only in an existing project.

New Message Set wizard Use this wizard to create a new message set. Before you start, you must have already created the message set project in which you want to create the message set. You can create a message set only in an existing project.
Select Message Definition file Select a message definition file from the workspace to include or import into the message definition file with which you are currently working.

topic.label: Linking from one message definition file to another

context.description: New Message Category wizard Use this wizard to create a new message category file. You can use message categories to group message sets within a message set project. You can also use a message category file for convenience or for assisting in the generation of Web Services Description Language (WSDL) files.
Properties Hierarchy Displays the message set properties hierarchy. You can configure logical properties, work with physical properties, and configure the documentation of the message set.
Message set logical properties View or update the logical properties of the message set.
Message set CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your message.

topic.label: Custom Wire Format message set properties

context.description: Message set XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your message.

topic.label: XML Wire Format message set properties

context.description: Message set TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your message.
Message set documentation Optionally enter text to document your message set.

topic.label: Documentation properties for all message set objects

context.description: Add Message From Global Element dialog To add a message to your message model from a global element, select from the drop-down list the global element that you want to use to create your message. The list includes all the global elements of a complex type that are not already associated with a message.

topic.label: Adding a message from a global element

context.description: Add a physical Format dialog Enter a name for the physical format you are creating. Physical format names must be unique within a message set. Start the name of your new physical format with CWF, XML, or TDS to identify the type of the physical format you are adding.
Type Selection dialog Select the type that you require from the list, and click OK.

topic.label: ESQL data types in message flows

context.description: Add Messages dialog This dialog lists all of the messages that you can add to your category file. Any message in the message set that is not already added to the category is displayed. Select the messages that you want to add to the message category, then click OK. The selected messages are added to the message category and are displayed in the properties hierarchy of the message category editor.

topic.label: Adding a message to a message category

context.description: New Simple Type dialog Set these properties to add a new local simple type. A global simple type can be used as the basis for more than one element. A local simple type is associated with a single element, and is not available for reuse elsewhere in the message model.

topic.label: Adding a simple type to an element

context.description: Outline view Displays resources in your message definition file. Click the resources to view their properties in the Message Definition editor.

Message Definition Editor Use this editor to edit message definition (.mxsd) files. The editor has two pages, called Overview and Properties, which you can access by clicking the tabs at the bottom left-hand corner of the editor.

topic.label: Working with a message definition file

context.description: Properties Hierarchy Displays properties of objects in your message definition file. To view the properties of an object, first click the Overview tab and select an object on that page, and then return to this page to view the properties of that object.
Message definition file properties Set these properties to configure the general properties of your message definition file.
Message definition file includes properties Set these properties to configure the includes properties of your message definition file.
Message definition file imports properties Set these properties to configure the imports properties of your message definition file.
Message logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your message.
Message XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your message.
Message TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your message.
Global element logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your global element.
Global element XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your global element.
Global element TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your global element.
Local element logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your local element.
Local element TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your local element.
Local element CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your local element.
Local element XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your local element.
Element reference logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your element reference.
Element reference CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your element reference.
Element reference XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your element reference.
Element reference TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your element reference.
Wildcard element logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your wildcard element.
Global group logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your global group.
Global group TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your global group.
Local group logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your local group.
Local group CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your local group.
Local group TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your local group.
Group reference logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your group reference.
Group reference CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your group reference.
Group reference TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your group reference.
Global attribute group logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your global attribute group.
Attribute group reference logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your attribute group reference.
Complex type logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your complex type.
Complex type TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your complex type.
Simple type logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your simple type.
Simple type value constraints Set these properties to configure the value constraints of your simple type.
Global attribute logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your global attribute.
Global attribute XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your global attribute.
Global attribute TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your global attribute.
Local attribute logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your local attribute.
Local attribute CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your local attribute.
Local attribute XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your local attribute.
Local attribute TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your local attribute.
Attribute reference logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your attribute reference.
Attribute reference CWF properties Set these properties to configure the CWF properties of your attribute reference.
Attribute reference XML properties Set these properties to configure the XML properties of your attribute reference.
Attribute reference TDS properties Set these properties to configure the TDS properties of your attribute reference.
Wildcard attribute logical properties Set these properties to configure the logical properties of your wildcard attribute.

New Simple Type dialog Set these properties to add a new simple type. A global simple type can be used as the basis for more than one element. A local simple type is associated with a single element, and is not available for reuse elsewhere in the message model.

topic.label: Adding a simple type to an element

context.description: New Complex Type dialog Set these properties to add a new complex type.

topic.label: Adding a complex type to an element

context.description: Delete dialog Lists all the objects that will be deleted, including the one you have selected.
Properties Hierarchy Displays the message category properties hierarchy. Set these properties to configure the message category.
Message Definition documentation Optionally, enter text to document this object in your message definition file.

topic.label: Documentation properties for all message set objects

context.description: Message category properties Set Message Category Kind to describe the purpose of the message category. If the message category is to participate in the generation of WSDL documents, this property must be set to 'wsdl'. Use the Documentation field to enter information about your message category.
Message category member properties Set these properties to configure your message category member properties.
